title: Notes by the Way; or, what I saw in my rambles
author: Higginson, H. Talbot.
snippet: I first wentto school to the Rev. J. C. M'Alester's, which was then held in ameeting-house, where the old baths are now situated, at the foot ofShore Street, and we had the house right opposite to it. We could alsobathe at the foot of Shore Street on nice sand when the tide was in ;but since the railway has been made, and the filth of Belfast depositedon the banks opposite the town, all has been changed. The Kinnegarwas then a common surrounded by the sea, with the exception of asmall portion at the town end ; but it is now a rifle range for the militaryof Belfast and the Ulster Rifle Club.

title: Notes by the Way; or, what I saw in my rambles
author: Higginson, H. Talbot.
snippet: It was at one time a fashionable watering-place, and I remember whena child coming here with my father's family for our health. I first wentto school to the Rev. J. C. M'Alester's, which was then held in ameeting-house, where the old baths are now situated, at the foot ofShore Street, and we had the house right opposite to it. We could alsobathe at the foot of Shore Street on nice sand when the tide was in ;but since the railway has been made, and the filth of Belfast depositedon the banks opposite the town, all has been changed.
